intro: Arhynchium labrosum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed arhynchium, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically alternate in arrangement. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, which are borne on short pedicels. Arhynchium labrosum is typically found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
